---
name: global-error-handling
description: Handle errors and exceptions in Django and DRF applications using proper exception classes, logging, custom exception handlers, and graceful degradation patterns. Use this skill when raising or catching exceptions, using Django's ValidationError or Http404, implementing DRF exception handling, configuring logging, creating custom exception classes, setting up Sentry integration, writing error handling middleware, or implementing retry logic for external services.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When raising Django or DRF exceptions in views or services
- When catching and handling exceptions appropriately
- When using get_object_or_404 or similar shortcuts
- When implementing model validation with clean() method
- When creating custom DRF APIException subclasses
- When configuring custom exception handlers in DRF
- When setting up Python logging in Django settings
- When writing error handling middleware
- When implementing graceful degradation for external service failures
- When integrating Sentry or other error tracking tools
- When writing try/except blocks with proper error handling
- When implementing retry logic with exponential backoff
- When testing error scenarios in API tests
- When providing user-friendly error messages without exposing internals

# Global Error Handling

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle global error handling.

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
